zone.line: dreams
Thou, who didst waken from his summer
The blue m Mediterranean, where he lay
Lulled by the coil of his chrystalline streams
Beside a pumice isle in Baiae's bay,
old
And saw in th sleep dim palaces & towers
Quivering within the wave's intenser day
All overgrown with azure moss & flowers
So sweet, the sense faints, picturing them.
Thou
For whose path the Atlantic's level powers
Cleave themselves into chasms, while far
below
The sea-blooms & the oozy woods which wear
The sapless foliage of the Ocean, know
Thy voice, & suddenly grow grey with
fear,
And tremble & despoil themselves —
o hear!
